org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core
Class CloudSimShutdown

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.SimEntity
      org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSimShutdown
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class CloudSimShutdown
extends SimEntity

CloudimShutdown waits for termination of all CloudSim user entities to determine the end of simulation.

This class will be created by CloudSim upon initialisation of the simulation, i.e. done via CloudSim.init() method. Hence, do not need to worry about creating an object of this class.

This object signals the end of simulation to CloudInformationService (GIS) entity.

Since:
CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
Author:
Manzur Murshed, Rajkumar Buyya

Constructor Detail

CloudSimShutdown

public CloudSimShutdown(java.lang.String name,
                        int numUser)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Allocates a new CloudSimShutdown object.

The total number of grid user entity plays an important role to determine whether all hostList should be shut down or not. If one or more users are still not finish, then the hostList will not be shut down. Therefore, it is important to give a correct number of total grid user entity. Otherwise, CloudSim program will hang or encounter a weird behaviour.

Parameters:
name - the name to be associated with this entity (as required by SimEntity class)
numUser - total number of grid user entity
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty
See Also:
gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean)
Method Detail

processEvent

public void processEvent(SimEvent ev)
The main method that shuts down hostList and Cloud Information Service (GIS). In addition, this method writes down a report at the end of a simulation based on reportWriterName defined in the Constructor.
NOTE: This method shuts down grid hostList and GIS entities either AFTER all grid users have been shut down or an entity requires an abrupt end of the whole simulation. In the first case, the number of grid users given in the Constructor must be correct. Otherwise, CloudSim package hangs forever or it does not terminate properly.

Specified by:
processEvent in class SimEntity
Parameters:
ev - the ev

startEntity

public void startEntity()
Description copied from class: SimEntity
This method is invoked by the Simulation class when the simulation is started. This method should be responsible for starting the entity up.

startEntity in class SimEntity

shutdownEntity

public void shutdownEntity()
Description copied from class: SimEntity
This method is invoked by the Simulation before the simulation finishes. If you want to save data in log files this is the method in which the corresponding code would be placed.

Specified by:
shutdownEntity in class SimEntity
